articles.description: Follow live text and radio coverage as Celtic visit Scottish Premiership bottom side Livingston.
articles.title: Scottish Premiership: Livingston v Celtic - will visitors reclaim top spot?

articles.description: Follow live text updates from Manchester United v Everton and West Ham v Brighton in the Premier League.
articles.title: WSL: Build-up to Man Utd v Everton before West Ham v Brighton

articles.description: Thomas Tuchel says "congratulations to Leverkusen" as he concedes the Bundesliga title race is over after Bayern Munich lose Der Klassiker to Borussia Dortmund.
articles.title: 'Congratulations Leverkusen' - Tuchel concedes title

articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says Sunday's opponents and title rivals Manchester City have "raised the bar to levels not seen before".
articles.title: Man City level 'not seen before in football' - Arteta

articles.description: England want to continue to "let off the handbrake" in attack during the Women's Six Nations, says captain Marlie Packer.
articles.title: England want to 'let off the handbrake' - Packer

articles.description: Giannis Antetokounmpo scores 36 points and makes 16 rebounds as the Milwaukee Bucks beat the Atlanta Hawks 122-113.
articles.title: NBA: Milwaukee Bucks beat Atlanta Hawks 122-113 as Giannis Antetokounmpo scores 36 points

articles.description: Barcelona keep the pressure on La Liga leaders Real Madrid by reducing the gap at the top to five points.
articles.title: Raphinha winner helps Barca cut Real Madrid's lead

articles.description: Brentford manager Thomas Frank says he "almost lost faith in the football god" before his side snatched a dramatic draw with Manchester United.
articles.title: Frank 'almost lost faith in the football god'

articles.description: American Danielle Collins beats fourth seed Elena Rybakina in straight sets to win the Miami Open - the first WTA 1,000 title of her career.
articles.title: Miami Open: Danielle Collins beats Elena Rybakina in women's final

articles.description: Arsenal manager Jonas Eidevall insists there is no "mental obstacle" for his side ahead of their Women's League Cup final against Chelsea on Sunday.
articles.title: Arsenal have no 'mental obstacle' before Chelsea final
